summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated June 18, 2019, following up on a meeting about the Epstein investigation. It attaches a finalized prosecution memo, discusses ongoing work on a draft indictment, and notes that the case was presented to a grand jury that day, which was 'extremely engaged and receptive.'

persons.name: Berman Geoffrey
persons.context: The email is addressed to Geoffrey Berman, who was the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time, regarding the Epstein investigation prosecution memo.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentation
events.description: The case against Jeffrey Epstein was presented to a grand jury, which was described as 'extremely engaged and receptive.'

events.title: Prosecution Memo Finalized
events.description: A prosecution memo addressing the factual basis for proposed charges and legal issues against Jeffrey Epstein was finalized and attached to this email.

keyFacts: A prosecution memo for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation was finalized and circulated on June 17-18, 2019.
The case was presented to a grand jury on June 18, 2019, and the prosecutors found the grand jury 'extremely engaged and receptive.'
Prosecutors were working on a draft indictment and planned to return to the grand jury for a final indictment based on the information presented.
The email demonstrates active federal prosecution efforts against Epstein in the Southern District of New York in mid-2019.
The correspondence highlights coordination and support within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Epstein case.
